intro: Pleiarina tetrasperma, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often forming a rosette of leaves with a central stem that bears the blooms. Its botanical features include opposite leaves with serrated edges and flowers that come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white. It is widely cultivated as a decorative plant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
